titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the United States, Confederate States, and foreign currency collection 1974.120
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 14:21:40 +0000.

did.unittitle: United States, Confederate States, and foreign currency collection
did.abstract: This collection contains bank notes, fractional currency, postage stamps, and treasury notes printed in the State of New York and various other American states during the period 1690 to 1865, with the bulk dating from 1775 to 1865. Also included are various forms of paper currency printed by the Confederate States of America during the Civil War, as well as currency printed by various foreign countries, such as Brazil, China, the Dominican Republic, and Japan. Two bound volumes containing historical sketches of paper money printed in the continental United States and the State of Pennsylvania are also included.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); United States, Confederate States, and foreign currency collection, 1974.120, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Fred T. Aldridge, 1891; Burt P. Greenman, date unknown; Charles Hallock, date unknown; J.S. Hicks, date unknown; John A. King, 1898; William Cary Langer, date unknown; Daniel Church McEwen, 1898; William Miles, date unknown; the North Carolina Historical Commission, date unknown; James L. Phelps, Jr., 1870; John P. Rolfe, date unknown; Reuben W. Ropes, date unknown; N.H.T. Squires, date unknown; B.C. Weekes, 1921; Julius Wilcox, 1890; and H.F. Wing, date unknown. Collection formally accessioned in 1974.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection assembled in 1936 from various donations.
